result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Dale Kirsch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Dale Kirsch in court, in custody at Brown County Jail.  Attorney John Herman in court for Adam Dale Kirsch.  Attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Present bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ALL PRIOR CONDITIONS REMAIN.
Defendant to have no contact with B.N., C.H. or their residence or place of employment.
Defendant can not be within 1,000 feet of BLN.

Defendant Adam Dale Kirsch appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney M. Crosby appeared via zoom on behalf of the defendant.
Prosecuting attorney Kevin Charles Greene appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Emailed to warrants - DW
Defendant has failed to comply with the conditions of release on bond by failing to comply with GPS conditions through ADL Monitoring Solutions.
Violation Report - ADL Monitoring Solutions

Asst. District Attorney Kevin Greene appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Adam Dale Kirsch in court.  Attorney John Herman in court for Adam Dale Kirsch. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Assistant District Attorney Meranda Hillmann appears on behalf of the State. Attorney John Herman in court. Defendant Adam Dale Kirsch appears via Zoom. Court modifies bond and orders defendant not to be within 1000 feet of BLN. Court also modifies house arrest conditions. All other conditions remain.

Assistant District Attorney Meranda Hillmann appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Adam Dale Kirsch appears via Zoom.  Attorney John Herman in court for Adam Dale Kirsch. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court modifies signature bond conditions. All other conditions remain.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with BN, CH or their residence or place of employment. Defendant cannot be within 1000 feet of BLN.
House Arrest at 1428 S Baird to be monitored by Electronic Monitoring. Defendant may leave residence for employment at 2420 Sycamore Dr. #17 between 6:30 p.m. - 9:30 p.m. Defendant may also attend appointments at the CTC, however must provide ADL with prior notice.
Motion hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Herman. Asst. District Attorney Hannah Schuchart appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Herman stated that he is going to file a motion to address GPS restrictions. Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record.
Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
